channel.title: Hello, new to the community
channel.description:
where is a good place to find patches?
I am looking to do some audio in ambient stuff

item.title: Hello, new to the community
item.dc:creator: @Eli5 Eli
item.description:
@Eli5 wrote:

Thank you guys, I didn't know the Axoloti software was connected to the community patches that's very interesting and convenient.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello, new to the community
item.dc:creator: @geecen
item.description:
@geecen wrote:

Hello!

Yea definitely explore the library first I'd say. You can also look at the help patch for each object.

For more elaborate patches you're in the right place.

Read full topic

item.title: Hello, new to the community
item.dc:creator: @mtyas Matthew Tyas
item.description:
@mtyas wrote:

Hi, and welcome to this community

Some patches can be found on this forum, with simple URL's, but the easiest way to find patches, is in the Library : "File -> Library -> " in the factory or community folder.
For ambient stuff, I haven't got anything to recommend to you, but the best thing to do is to make your own patches. Axoloti is great for slow droning instruments. Just play around with oscillators types, filters, envelopes, and LFO's for slight and slow modulations.
Ambient style is so vast in sounds that I really don't know where to point.

Read full topic
